definitions.definition: Relating to, or characteristic of life.
definitions.example: vital energies; vital functions; vital actions

definitions.definition: Necessary to the continuation of life; being the seat of life; being that on which life depends.
definitions.example: The brain is a vital organ.
The transition to farming was vital for the creation of civilisation.

definitions.definition: Relating to the recording of life events.
definitions.example: Birth, marriage and death certificates are vital records.
It is vital that you don't forget to do your homework.

definitions.definition: Capable of living; in a state to live; viable.
